message.content:
cs.DS, cs.OR, cs.LG, cs.CC, cs.GT. 

The paper deals with optimization problems related to scheduling and resource allocation, which are typically studied in the Operations Research (cs.OR) and Algorithms (cs.DS) communities. The use of linear programming and covering inequalities suggests a connection to the fields of Linear Programming (cs.LG) and Combinatorics (cs.CC). Finally, the mention of approximation algorithms and constant factor approximation suggests a connection to the field of Game Theory (cs.GT), which often deals with finding optimal solutions in the presence of strategic agents.
